edge: Clint Eastwood plays the role of Frankie Dunn, a gruff but well-meaning elderly boxing trainer
Hilary Swank portrays Maggie Fitzgerald, a determined and aspiring boxer trained by Frankie Dunn
Morgan Freeman enacts Eddie 'Scrap-Iron' Dupris, Dunn's gym assistant and former boxer

node_2: dangerous dillard fighting flippo bam-bam barch or "danger"
edge: Jay Baruchel acts as Dangerous Dillard Fighting Flippo Bam-Bam Barch or 'Danger', a simpleton would-be boxer
Mike Colter depicts Willie 'Big Willie' Little, a boxer whom Dunn has trained for years
Lucia Rijker enacts Billie 'The Blue Bear' Osterman, a former prostitute and vicious boxer
In the movie, Father Horvak is played by an actor but his character name is same as his name in the cast list.
Anthony Mackie portrays Shawrelle Berry, an overzealous boxer and frequent tenant of Dunn's gym
Margo Martindale represents Earline Fitzgerald, Maggie's selfish mother
Riki Lindhome acts as Mardell Fitzgerald, Maggie's welfare-cheating sister
Michael Peña performs the role of Omar, a boxer and Shawrelle's best friend
Bruce MacVittie plays the character of Mickey Mack
Marcos Chait plays the role of J.D. Fitzgerald, Maggie's incarcerated brother
Tom McCleister portrays Mr. Johnson, a lawyer
Grant L. Roberts performs as Billie's Cut Man
